name: giantants
text: I like this trip because it would be utterly baffling out of context. Also, "ducats" has got to be one of the funniest things there has been hell of in the strip's entire run.

name: thesyndicate88
text:
My friends and I once decided that Ducats sounds like the name of a cheap beer.

"You just put in a hard day at work. Relax with a frosty mug of Ducats!"

name: dorothypoopbot
text: Dead for a Ducats!

name: aclashinredsnow
text: "Dead for a Ducat" is the name of a band that several of my friends are in and for the briefest of moments I thought someone else who reads Achewood had heard of an obscure Chicago rock band before I remembered that whole Shakespeare thing.

name: thesoulbear
text:
Quite simply my favorite strip.

"Fine then here comes an amendment against frosty ones."

name: deimosrising
text: This is my favorite example of RB's personal dialect. I'm one of the few people who doesn't consider him a favorite character, but sometimes he really is awesome.

name: red_rooster
text: i think people love RB so much because he's wicked deep, as evidenced above.

name: deimosrising
text: I think they love him so much because he's the most relatable character to an internet full of computer nerds with confidence issues, which is not to say that he's representative of the Achewood readership, only that there is a sentimental attachment to him which does not exist for a rich hip hop loving dilettante or a psychotic West Virginian mass murderer.

name: stuart
text: Maybe you can't sentimentally relate to a West Virginian mass murderer

name: deimosrising
text: I'm from West Virginia and Ray and Nice Pete are my favorite characters which is why I picked them.

name: stuart
text: So you moved from WV to Mexico?

name: mystkmanat
text: Completely agree.  I once told my friend that I love Roast Beef "because he reminds me of the most terrible, aching, pathetic parts of myself, brought to life-- but in a good way!"

name: zathyr
text:
Philippe is my favorite character probably because emotionally I am 5 years old. Also, I am an alive stuffed animal (otter).

Roast Beef is pretty cool though. Ironically, he reminds me of myself when I was younger.

name: zapatos
text: Yeah, that pretty much hammers the nail.  Hits the spot?  Is correct.

name: thesoulbear
text: Hits the nail on the head.

name: zapatos
text: That poor little nail.

name: catachresis
text: Points for choosing completely the most difficult historical event to Roomba-ify

name: waddlerz
text: Props for making up Roomba-ify and simultenously complimenting RB on his Roomba-ing abilities

name: hellofyellin
text: In my life, I have never cared about a cartoon cat so much.

name: billylk
text: Somewhere a morbidly obese orange cat is sobbing his way to the bottom of another lasagna pan.

name: hellofyellin
text:
Man, when I found out at the tender age of 9 that Garfield wasn't even drawn by Jim Davis anymore, it broke my heart. He brought it upon himself.

That and the whole not being funny thing.

name: zem
text: wait - it's not??

name: zem
text: drawn by jim davis i mean

name: hellofyellin
text: *except for Hobbes.  Man I can't believe I forgot him.

name: atmus
text: Hobbes was a tiger, tigers are different from cats.

name: hellofyellin
text: You're different from cats.

name: tekende
text: Tigers are cats. Just really big cats.

name: greenkoolayd
text: tigers cant roar, but they can purr.

name: hellofyellin
text: Teodor left the room real quick to add another ladel-full of stock to his risotto.

name: mr_pete
text:
W.C. Fields once showed Groucho Marx his attic, which was stocked with crates of whiskey. "Bill," said Groucho, "They repealed Prohibition."

Fields stared at Marx. "But it might come back!" he whispered.

name: stuart
text: Every time I buy a shitload of drinks I quote this one to whoever is nearest.

name: professorhazard
text:
You quote the dialogue of two people as though you are both of them, or you quote the anecdote as mr_pete has done?

Also, you are not twenty-one. Do you use this story about Prohibition when you buy a 24-pack of Shasta, or what?

name: ford
text: I suppose he could be German

name: woodenteeth
text: ... or Australian.

name: utv
text: ... even Canadian.

name: tekende
text: Or Martian

name: invidious
text: Or just have a fuckin fake ID.

name: fattypneumonia
text: My fav Fields quote:  "I don't drink water.  Fish fuck in it."

name: centipede_damascus
text: The amendment against frosty ones was not well received.

name: unsentletter
text:
The amendment reinstating frosty ones was. Thank goodness.

Look, there's even a bar in SF named after it = http://www.21st-amendment.com/

name: afronaut
text: Fuck this is a good strip. Holy hell

name: dovey
text: 5 for Beef's dialogue in panel 2

name: dovey
text: Also a mournful shake of the head that it is not rated higher

name: ezcmac
text: Look at him in that new shirt! How could he BE so cocky?!

name: ikrizzle
text:
I once wrote an essay on prohibition for AP US history and used the term "an amendment against frosty ones."

A-

name: charchar
text: Damn! T took my test of Progressivism and the Prohibition era the day before I read this . Sweet merciful Neptune is there no justice?

name: fidget
text: Hey!  This was my 18th birthday.  18th birthday... 18th amendment... coincidence?  I think not.

name: catgrl131
text: Well, actually, probably.

name: tellumo
text:
That's how I remember which amendments began and repealed Prohibition: You can't drink in the US when you turn 18, but you can when you turn 21.

I am all kinds of fun at cocktail parties.

name: peterjoel
text: I guess Teodor was busy that day.

name: rowboat
text: That's what I thought at first, but then it occurred to me that if Teodor had been present, there wouldn't have been any roombaing to be done. The "VROOOOOO" is of the utmost importance.

name: dtuba
text: No. Beef needs no help on this one.

name: tbtabby
text: As funny as this is, I much preferred the Paradox Press version: "The Battle of the Booze!"

name: taiiga
text:
this.. this MIGHT.

this MIGHT be my favorite achewood.

don't hold me to that. but it could be.

name: ceres
text: I love this one. It makes me happy in so many ways, some of which are probably illegal.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Weekend Blogs (Friday - Sunday)/b]

-Ray-
It's a Chochacho Night Friday.

-Roast Beef-
Friday not much better
Saturday turned out OK

-Pat-
I am [b]damn glad I bought these Earth Shoes

-Philippe-
Free Shrimp!
Good Morning!
I slept in today!

-Mr. Bear-
A bit of an underhanded visit.
Dirty Pool

-Lyle-
taco truck
spit hooch emperor

-Molly-
I guess we're off to Ray's...

-Onstad-
Where the hell is he?
True Dread.
Where the hell is he?

-Nice Pete-
going out tomorrow

-Little Nephew-
Uncle Ray got FOOLISH ingredients in the fridge!!

name: xiaomimi
text: Dammit I knew I'd fuck it up eventually

name: mysterymeat1001
text:
So far I've only seen 2 fuckups in all 200 blog posts.

You have my nomination for Queen of BBCode.

name: i_love_kate
text: We elect queens now?

name: mysterymeat1001
text: You can do anything at Achewood. Anything at all.

name: le_baron_noir
text:
Quote:
"There is nothing like breakfast and money to make a man feel smart." - Cornelius Bear

Onstad is the Benjamin Franklin of our time. Only more important.

It's a strange feeling to want to model oneself after a cartoon bear. But how could you not?

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Ray: Kind of a burner Sunday
Philippe: A painting of me!
Molly: Friday party, picnic, etc.
Onstad: Calm spoiled.
Little Nephew: Tha Dribbla'!

name: chachibenji
text: Abolitionists were just all against a man gettin his cold sip on.

name: xiaomimi
text: And prohibitionists got just plain furious about slavery!

name: genequagmire
text: Epic.

name: arelladawn
text: 5 for the bowtie and hip lingo.

name: carlyle
text:
I like this strip because it makes me imagine the president saying "cut that shit out" from some balcony on the Whitehouse to all the protesters out there.

(not any president in particular. Choose the one you think is funniest)

name: izzhov
text: This is brilliant, because I'm supposed to be studying for a US History Final I have tomorrow.

name: greenkoolayd
text: as far as this strip goes, technically, you WERE studying.

name: treatyofparis
text: Reading back on these comics.... 2004 might have been the best achewood year. Discuss.

name: ezri
text: I disagree. I am actually reading through Achewood for the first time, and I would say that 2002 or 2003 might be it's strongest years so far. 2004 has been a little weaker (but still awesome of course).

name: icecube
text: "History... on The March!" is a pleasing Citizen Kane reference, with timing well reproduced by ellipses.

name: wacks
text:
Beef muscle meat can be nbrc exam cut into steak, roasts or short ribs. Some cuts are processed (corned beef or beef jerky), and trimmings, usually mixed with meat from older, leaner cattle, are ground, minced or used in sausages. The blood is used in some varieties of blood sausage. Other parts that are eaten include the gmat exam
oxtail, tongue, tripe from the reticulum or rumen, gland (particularly the pancreas and thymus) referred to as sweetbread, the heart, the brain (although forbidden where there is a gre exam danger of bovine spongiform encephalopathy, BSE), the liver, the ncbtmb exam kidneys, and the tender testicles of the bull (known in the US as calf fries, prairie oysters, or Rocky Mountain oysters). Some intestines are eaten as-is, but are used more often as natural sausage casings. The lungs and the udder are nce exam considered unfit for human consumption in the isee exam US. Beef bones are used for ncidq exam making beef stock.

name: soticoto
text:
Marker comment.

Say what you like, but it works.

name: potash
text: Thanks for sharing this post. This is a very helpful and informative material like ccent . Good post and keep it up. Websites are always helpful in one way or the other, that%u2019s cool stuff, anyways, a good way to get started to renovate your dreams ccie into the world of reality.I will write more in detail after my pmp and ccna very soon. Thanks!
